translation.en: having exited the tunnel safely, let's talk about this car.
translation.ko: 터널을 안전하게 나간 뒤 이 차부터 설명하겠습니다

translation.en: The Lamborghini Miura was the first supercar. Two seats,
translation.ko: "제작 당시 가장 빠른 양산 차" 미우라는 첫 슈퍼카로 좌석이 두 개이며

translation.en: rear-wheel drive, mid-engined, and, as the Italians say...
molto molto bellissimo.
I love the fact that we're driving this beautiful car
and we have the Italian Alps as the panoramic view in front of us.
Launched in 1966, the Miura's the same age as me,
and looking a lot better on it.
When this hit the motor show, everybody just went crazy.
translation.ko: 이 차가 모터쇼에 나가자 다들 난리가 났죠

translation.en: No-one had ever seen anything like this, a mid-engined Italian supercar.
translation.ko: 미드 엔진 이탈리아 슈퍼카는 다들 처음 봤거든요

translation.en: It's so radical, and it drives beautifully.
They only built 763 Miuras, and while, of course, Italians loved them,
as with all supercars, most were sold abroad.
It feels like a race car, it doesn't feel like a road car.
It feels like you're in a race car.
Sammy Davis Jr., Dean Martin and Frank Sinatra all had Miuras.
translation.ko: 새미 데이비스 주니어 딘 마틴, 시나트라의 차죠

translation.en: When asked why he hadn't bought a Ferrari, Sinatra replied,
translation.ko: 왜 페라리를 안 샀냐는 물음에 시나트라는 이렇게 답했습니다

translation.en: "You buy a Ferrari when you want to be somebody.
translation.ko: '특별한 사람이 되고 싶을 땐 페라리를 산다'

translation.en: You buy a Lamborghini when you are somebody."
Right. Time to introduce that bloke in the passenger seat.
He is Francesco de Carlo, comedian, car lover, and a man who knows
translation.ko: 프란체스코 데 카를로는 코미디언이자 차 애호가이며

translation.en: what driving in this country is all about.
Tell me about driving in Italy.
Oh... First of all, the position of your hands on the wheel.
-Yeah. -You drive ten to two.
-Yeah. -But the Italian way is midday.
-It's your hand on the side-- -Yeah, yes. Who have to show off
translation.ko: - 다른 손은 치우고... - 네, 뽐내는 거죠

translation.en: -that you're a cool guy, you know. -Okay.
We call it, "Making la bella figura," you know, making a good impression.
translation.ko: 이탈리아인은 이걸 두고 멋진 인상을 남긴다고 해요

translation.en: -Yeah. -That's why we want
to show off, every time, what we are doing.
translation.ko: - 네 - 멋진 인상을 남기려고 뭘 하든 뽐내죠

translation.en: So, cars are kind of like a status symbol.
-Then you need the sunglasses, of course. -Okay.
And don't... Don't think about the pedestrians.
We just don't like pedestrians.
[Paul] As we enter the town of Ivrea, fifty miles north of Turin,
we're coming across quite a few pedestrians,
and that's exposing a bit of a Miura design flaw.
This car is so low that when people walk across,
translation.ko: 차 높이가 아주 낮아서 사람들이 지나가면

translation.en: -you just have a crotch view. -Yeah, yeah, yeah. I don't think
that this is the reason why they were so low. I don't.
translation.ko: 이 이유로 차가 이렇게나 낮은 건 아니겠죠

translation.en: [Paul] I don't know, maybe we've found something in this.
translation.ko: 우리가 새 이유를 찾아낸 건 아닐까요?

translation.en: [Francesco] Even if we are in Italy, we are not so obsessed about sex...
-You had a crotch fetish. -...to build that... "Crotch fetish"!
translation.ko: - 가랑이 페티시가 있나 봐요 - 가랑이 페티시라니!

translation.en: [Francesco] No, no. We are good people, we don't think about crotches.
translation.ko: 우린 좋은 사람들이에요 가랑이 생각 안 해요

translation.en: We... This country's very passionate about everything. It's love and hate.
translation.ko: 우린 모든 것에 열정적이에요 사랑과 증오가 함께 가고

translation.en: Tragedy and comedy are together. We are brave and cowards.
translation.ko: 비극과 희극이 함께하죠 우린 용감하며 겁이 많아요

translation.en: We are the top of every kind of emotion. I think that the cars are the same.
translation.ko: 모든 감정을 강렬하게 느끼는데 우리 차도 마찬가지예요

translation.en: They reflect the spirit of the country in which they are built.
-Yeah. -You know? So, the British cars
are very, very silent and classy. The German cars are very powerful
translation.ko: 조용하고 기품 있고 독일 차는 강력하고

translation.en: -and reliable. -Yeah.
And I think the Italian cars are noisy.
So, it's all about hands, isn't it?
translation.ko: 이탈리아인은 말도 많고 손짓도 많이 하죠?

translation.en: Yeah, obviously. The hand gesture is very important for us,
-even when you drive a car. -Yeah.
'Cause there are a lot of signs, you know.
-"Keep moving." "Keep on." -Yeah.
"Come on." "It's my time," you know. You have to learn this.
translation.ko: 이젠 내 차례라든지 이런 신호는 배워야 해요

translation.en: -And then there is this gesture. -What, that?
-If you want to offend another driver… -Yeah.
...this is very old-fashioned, but still good. It means that...
-your wife is cheating on you. -You're kidding me.
-Yeah, yeah. -That?
Yeah, yeah, yeah. We use it for the other drivers or a referee.
It's very popular.
So, if someone--
-Cut you off? -Yeah, yeah, yeah. You just say...
"You're cornuto." It means cornuto.
[Paul] The real reason we've come to Ivrea is because Francesco reckons
translation.ko: 이브레아에 온 진짜 이유는 이 도시가

translation.en: this town can answer my question about why Italians
build such brilliant supercars by way of a potentially
translation.ko: 무척이나 아픈 비유를 들어 답할 수 있기 때문입니다

translation.en: -very painful metaphor. -Do you like oranges?
translation.ko: 무척이나 아픈 비유를 들어 답할 수 있기 때문입니다 오렌지 좋아해요?

translation.en: -I love oranges, yeah. -Yeah, yeah.
You will see a lot of oranges.
[Paul] This is the battle of the oranges.
Dating back to 1808, the Festival has something to do
with Ivrea's ordinary citizens revolting against the wicked landowners of the time.
In reality, it's actually just a massive orange fight.
-[Paul] I think trouble's coming. -[Francesco] I can feel the tension.
-Something is happening. -Yeah.
[Paul] To start with, we watch from a safe distance,
bravely standing behind some netting.
[Francesco] Oh, my God.
Those guys in there are getting absolutely pummeled.
translation.ko: 저 안쪽 사람들이 제대로 맞고 있어요

translation.en: [Francesco] You see, that's why we build supercars, because we love excitement,
we love extreme life, you know? We love passion.
-[Paul] Yeah, yeah. -You can be hurt here, you can be killed,
but we will never get bored in this country, never.
translation.ko: 이 나라에서 지루할 일은 절대 없어요

translation.en: -Wow. -Look at them.
[Paul] That is absolutely crazy. It's like going back 400 years, isn't it?
Yeah. It's an ancient ritual. You can feel it in the blood.
-This is what we… -[Paul laughs]
It's just a constant battering. Look at the amount of oranges
-on the floor down there now, look. -Yeah, yeah, yeah.
[Paul] Italians have a knack for making life exciting to live...
and that just makes you want to get a piece of the action.
Do you know what? Shall we go down there?
Yes, I know it. I knew it.
-Come on. Let's just have a go. -Let's try it, I know.
translation.ko: - 하고 싶을 줄 알았어요 - 가요 - 가봅시다 - 해보죠

translation.en: You've got to do it haven't you?
They take this orange business to a level which you think...
translation.ko: 무슨 생각인 건지 모를 정도로 심각하게

translation.en: "What are you thinking?"
[laughs] I'll take a few of them.
It thrilled you. It scared you at the same time.
[Paul] I got hit in the mouth, with a couple of oranges, but...
Wow, crazy Italians.
But if you do join in, don't scare the horses.
Everyone involved considers their safety to be paramount,
and you really don't want to upset thousands
of Italians armed with oranges.
-I'm empty, mate. -No, really?
Yeah. Look what's on the floor!
[Francesco] You have, on the floor, oranges, horse shit and blood,
which is a perfect metaphor for life.
[Paul] And as a closing thought to my Italian road trip,
you can't say fairer than that.
So, what have I learnt? Well, Italians are dreamers.
Most of them will never own a supercar.
[Bruno] Grazie!
[Paul] However, they love what these extraordinary machines
say about them and their nation.
-It's a one-off. My baby. -I know.
At the same time, they're realists and embrace what they have.
translation.ko: 또한 그들은 현실주의자이며 가진 것을 포용합니다

translation.en: Who knew that working in a laundry or getting hit in the face
translation.ko: 세탁소에서 일하거나 얼굴에 오렌지를 맞는 게

translation.en: with an orange could be so exhilarating?
What the Italians have, and they have lots of it,
whether it be their food, their styling, their throwing of oranges,
their supercars, their practical cars, they have one thing in common.
translation.ko: 슈퍼카와 실용적인 차까지 모두 한 가지를 공유하죠

translation.en: Passione!
Passion.
That is what makes Italian cars fantastic.
